greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of strict integer partitions of n containing no prime indices of the parts.
comment: A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798.
example: The a(1) = 1 through a(13) = 8 strict integer partitions (A...D = 10...13):
xref: The subset version is A324741, with maximal case A324743. The non-strict version is A324756. The Heinz number version is A324758. An infinite version is A304360.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 16 2019
